kihkcwz9Text: MADRS PDQ DSST SDS UPSA SHAPS EEfRT MEI GAS-DODQ
kihkcwzaText: ODQ - Oxford Depression Questionnaire1,2
kihkcwzbText:
The ODQ is a 26-item, self-reported scale evaluating emotional symptoms in patients
treated with antidepressants
kihkcwzcText:
The ODQ covers 5 dimensions across 3 sections on a 5-point Likert scale;
higher scores indicate a higher severity in symptoms
kihkcwzdText:
All my emotions, both ‘pleasant’
and ‘unpleasant’, are ‘toned
down’
kihkcwzeText:
I don’t fully enjoy things that
should give me pleasure, such
as beautiful places or things or
music
kihkcwzfText:
I care less about other people’s
feelings than I think I should
kihkcwzgText:
The antidepressant is preventing
me from feeling my emotions in
some way
kihkcwzhText:
The antidepressant seems to
make me just not care about
things that should matter to me
kihkcwziText:
Day-to-day life just doesn’t
have the same emotional
impact on me that it did
before my illness / problem
kihkcwzsText: cause (AC)
